sentences.text: April 28, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dear Fellow Shareholder:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 was a successful  and pivotal  year for Time Warner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We once again delivered strong operating and financial performance, as we continued to execute a strategy that has driven superior returns for our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also took the historic step of entering into an agreement to merge Time Warner with AT&T Inc., which will dramatically accelerate our ability to deliver great video content  and great consumer experiences  to audiences in the U.S. and around the globe.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Execution of Strategy Drove Strong Financial Results and Leading Shareholder Returns
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our 2016 financial results reflected the ongoing success of the core strategy we began implementing several years ago, focused on creating and delivering high-quality branded video content across platforms to audiences around the world.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Last year, Time Warner increased revenue by 4%, grew both Operating Income and Adjusted Operating Income by 10%, increased EPS by 8% and Adjusted EPS by 23%, and generated over $4 billion of both Cash Provided by Operations from Continuing Operations and Free Cash Flow.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We delivered a total shareholder return of over 52%, well ahead of the 11% average for our major media peers and 12% for the S&P 500.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: That built on a strong record of delivering superior returns to our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From January 1, 2008 through the end of last year, Time Warner delivered a total shareholder return, including reinvested dividends, of 268%, compared to 178% for our media peers and 88% for the S&P 500.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Using the headline price of $107.50 per share consideration in the AT&T transaction, Time Warners total return would be even higher  at approximately 310%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In other words, $100 invested in Time Warner common stock at the outset of 2008 would return about $410 at the closing of the transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: And a shareholder who held on to the common stock of the companies we spun off during that period would realize even more from his or her initial investment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Significant Progress Executing our Strategy in 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we made significant progress executing our strategy and achieving the objectives discussed below, which were outlined in the letter from the Chairman and the Lead Independent Director in last years proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. Using our scale to create compelling content, and invest in a concentrated portfolio of strong brands, that resonate with consumers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Home Box Offices and Turners television networks continued their record of strong performance, with HBO receiving the most Primetime Emmy Awards of any network for the 15th year in a row and Turner having the #1 news network and three of the top five ad-supported cable channels in primetime among adults 18-49.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed in last years letter, we also expanded and strengthened our networks programming.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To its already strong line-up, HBO added Westworld  produced by Warner Bros.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: which was the most-watched freshman series in HBOs history, as well as several successful comedies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Turner began a multi-year effort to refresh its programming at its two leading entertainment networks, TBS and TNT, with more original, cutting-edge programming to appeal to younger and multi-platform audiences  including launching Angie Tribeca, The Detour, Full Frontal with Samantha Bee and Wrecked on TBS, and Animal Kingdom on TNT, all of which were renewed for second seasons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Turner secured rights to the DC Entertainment and Star Wars movie franchises, adding to its roster of marquee franchise movies that already included The Hunger Games and Marvel Comics, and it extended its agreement with the NCAA for March Madness though 2032.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similarly, Warner Bros. retained its position as the #1 supplier of primetime series to broadcast networks for the 8th year in a row (and 13 of the past 14 years).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As we committed to last year, Warner Bros. also diversified its TV production slate, supplying more series to cable networks and OTT services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: And, in film, Warner Bros. ranked #2 at the box office with seven films grossing over $100 million at the domestic box office, while positioning itself for long-term success by launching its multi-year franchise slate with Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice and Suicide Squad from DC Entertainment and Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them from J.K. Rowlings Wizarding World.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. Leveraging our scale and technology to distribute our content both inside and outside the traditional media ecosystem to meet consumer demand.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Home Box Office and Turner renewed agreements with key traditional distributors, while executing on our commitment to expand distribution on new platforms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, Turner secured carriage on virtual MVPDs being offered by DirecTV and Hulu, LLC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Home Box Office expanded distribution of its OTT product to Microsofts Xbox, Sony Vue, and Amazon Prime Channels, contributing to continued growth in domestic OTT subscribers, which surpassed 2 million in early 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the same time, Turner launched its first direct-to-consumer streaming video on demand service  FilmStruck  and Warner Bros. acquired DramaFever, expanding its direct-to-consumer capabilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also invested to acquire a 10% ownership interest in Hulu, LLC, helping to foster greater consumer choice and competition in online video offerings  and more outlets for our content.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: And Turner continued to lead the industry in using technology to deliver more relevant and targeted advertising, for the benefit of both consumers and advertisers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. Expanding internationally to take advantage of growing demand for content and increasing pay TV and broadband penetration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continued to increase our scale in key territories with attractive long-term growth prospects.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Turner, for example, strengthened its programming and expanded the distribution for its networks in Latin America, while launching a number of new networks in EMEA and Asia-Pacific.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Home Box Office added to its international roster of stand-alone broadband offerings, launching OTT services in Argentina, Brazil, and Spain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Warner Bros. had a record-breaking year in international television, both in producing programming outside the U.S. and licensing its existing programming internationally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Warner Bros. also released 60 foreign language films internationally, while strategically increasing its local language film production efforts in countries such as China and Korea.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. Focusing on operating and capital efficiency to drive shareholder returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, we improved our operating margins while executing our disciplined capital allocation strategy: first, investing fully in our business (including over $15 billion in content and marketing); second, funding M&A and strategic investments like Hulu, LLC; and third, providing direct returns to our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Last year, we returned almost $3.6 billion to shareholders through share repurchases and dividends  including increasing our dividend by 15%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accelerating the Execution of Our Strategy through the AT&T Merger
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As stated in last years proxy statement letter, while the Companys core strategy of developing and broadly distributing best-in- class content has remained the same, our Board of Directors has been continually engaged with management in reviewing and refining our strategy in light of the evolving media landscape.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, the Board has guided the Company as weve increased our broadband and mobile offerings, and begun to build out our direct-to-consumer capabilities and products, to compete more effectively in meeting consumer expectations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: So, when we started speaking with AT&T in August, the Board saw the potential combination of Time Warners content with AT&Ts distribution and consumer relationships as a strategic path to dramatically accelerate Time Warners ability to innovate and deliver more choice and value to consumers across platforms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Were very pleased that, at a special meeting of shareholders in February, our shareholders overwhelmingly agreed with the Boards decision to combine the two companies, with about 79% of Time Warners outstanding shares as of the record date for the special meeting, and more than 99% of the votes cast, voting to approve the merger agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and management are now focused on successfully completing the merger this year, while we continue to aggressively execute Time Warners strategy as a stand-alone company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As we look ahead, we also want to express our thanks to those who have helped bring our Company to the threshold of a new era for Time Warner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, we want to express our appreciation or Steve Bollenbachs extraordinary contributions to our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Steve, who passed away last October, served on our Board for almost two decades, including chairing our Audit & Finance and Compensation & Human Development Committees and serving as Lead Independent Director since May 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was widely renowned for his financial acumen and business judgment; he was universally respected by fellow Directors for his steady leadership; and he was instrumental in overseeing, and highly supportive of our discussions with AT&T.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also want to thank the enormously talented employees of Time Warner, who enable this company o create and distribute the best video content in the world.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: And finally, we want to thank you, our shareholders, for your ongoing investment in and support of this company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We invite you to attend the Companys 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders, which will be held on Thursday, June 15, 2017, at 9:30 a.m. (local time) at Warner Bros.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Studio, 4000 Warner Boulevard, Burbank, California 91522.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are not able to attend, you may listen to the webcast live at www.timewarner.com/annualmeetingmaterials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Jeffrey L. Bewkes Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Robert C. Clark Lead Independent Director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 PROXY STATEMENT SUMMARY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This summary highlights information contained in this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company encourages you to read the entire Proxy Statement carefully before voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Time Warner Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Time Warner is a global leader in media and entertainment that owns and operates television networks and produces and distributes television programming, films, videogames and other high-quality video content worldwide on a multi-platform basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has three operating divisions: Turner, Home Box Office and Warner Bros.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leading domestic and international television networks and related digital properties in entertainment, sports, kids and news
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Largest integrated television, film and videogame studio in the world
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Time Warner and AT&T Merger Agreement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On October 22, 2016, Time Warner entered into an Agreement and Plan of Merger (the Merger Agreement) with AT&T Inc. (AT&T), pursuant to which Time Warner will combine with AT&T in a stock-and-cash transaction (the Merger).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Merger Agreement was unanimously approved by the boards of both companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Time Warners shareholders approved the Merger at a special meeting of shareholders held on February 15, 2017, with 78.83% of Time Warners outstanding shares as of the record date for the special meeting, and more than 99% of the votes cast, voting in favor of the adoption of the Merger Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Merger is conditioned on the receipt of certain antitrust reviews and approvals and other required regulatory consents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Merger is expected to close before year-end 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information on the transaction, please see the proxy statement of Time Warner related to the special meeting of shareholders, which is dated, and was filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission (the SEC) on, January 9, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Business Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Time Warners Strategy and AT&T Merger
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Time Warner has pursued a strategy of using its leading brands, distinctive intellectual property and global scale to capitalize on the growing demand for high-quality video content around the world.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: First, the Company invests in a concentrated portfolio of leading television networks, compelling television programming, top Hollywood movies, and other forms of video and digital content that appeal to audiences globally and across distribution platforms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Second, the Company uses its scale and technology to meet consumer demand for the Companys networks and content both inside and outside the traditional TV ecosystem, including delivering content directly to consumers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Third, the Company continues to expand its businesses internationally with a focus on increasing scale in territories with strong long-term growth potential.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, the Companys on-going focus on operating and capital efficiency delivers healthy profits and helps fund investments for future growth while providing attractive returns to shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors (the Board) engages with management throughout the year in overseeing the execution of the Companys strategy, as well as evaluating and refining the strategy to address changes in the industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In unanimously approving the Merger Agreement, the Board considered a number of factors, including how the Merger  by combining the Companys content with AT&Ts distribution capabilities  will accelerate the execution of the Companys strategy of offering consumers more choice and value in television network bundles, developing and launching innovative video services delivered directly to consumers over the internet and on mobile devices, and providing more value to advertisers and consumers through targeted advertising.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Strong Financial Performance in 2016(1)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The continued execution of the Companys long-term strategy led to the delivery of strong financial performance in 2016  Revenues increased 4% to $29.3 billion
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Operating Income grew 10% to $7.5 billion and Adjusted Operating Income grew 10% to $7.6 billion
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPANY PROPOSALS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 1: Election of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Nominees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors nominated each of the nine nominees named below for election as a director at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If elected by the shareholders, they will serve for a one-year term until
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the next annual meeting of shareholders and until their successors have been duly elected and qualified,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) their earlier death, resignation or retirement or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the closing of the Merger.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the nominees currently serves as a director of the Company and was elected by the shareholders at the 2016 annual meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any nominee is unable or unwilling to serve as a director at the time of the Annual Meeting, the persons named in the proxy card (who are appointed by shareholders as their proxies) intend to vote, in their discretion, for such other persons, if any, as may be designated by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the date of this Proxy Statement, the Board has no reason to believe that any of the nominees will be unable or unwilling to serve as a director if elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The persons named in the proxy card as shareholders proxies intend to vote such proxy for the election of each of the nominees, unless a shareholder indicates on the proxy card that the vote should be against any or all of the nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote Required for Election of Director Nominees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the election of the directors at the Annual Meeting is uncontested, a director nominee must receive a majority of the votes duly cast by the holders of Common Stock with respect to that director nominee to be elected (i.e., the number of for votes for a director nominee must exceed the number of against votes for that director nominee).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an incumbent director nominee receives more against votes than for votes in an uncontested election, the director must submit, no later than two weeks following the certification of the shareholder vote by the Company, an offer to resign from the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board will consider the resignation offer and may either accept the resignation offer or reject it and seek to address the underlying cause(s) of the against votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is required to make its determination within 90 days following the certification of the shareholder vote and make a public announcement of its decision, including a statement regarding the reasons for its decision if the Board rejects the resignation offer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions and broker non-votes are not considered votes cast in the election of director nominees and will have no effect on the election of director nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6  Time Warner Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notice of 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders and Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 1: Election of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Nomination Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are a number of different ways an individual can be nominated for election to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominations Developed by the Nominating Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee follows the steps described below to identify and propose an individual for election to the Board:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee considers the composition of the Board as part of its annual self-evaluation process and conducts periodic assessments of the overall composition of the Board in light of the Companys current and expected future business needs and, based on such assessments, may establish specific qualifications that it will seek in Board candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee reports on these assessments to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee seeks advice and the names of potential director candidates from members of the Board, management, major shareholders, and other public and private sources.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee sometimes retains a search firm to assist it in these efforts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee reviews the qualifications of incumbent candidates for re-nomination to the Board annually, including any incumbent candidates elected through proxy access.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee recommends a slate of director candidates, which may include both incumbent and new director nominees, to submit for shareholder approval at the annual meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee may also recommend that the Board elect new directors who will serve until the next annual meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Recommendations and Nominations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders may submit names of director candidates to the Nominating Committee for its consideration by following the process described under General Information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders may submit names of director candidates directly to the Companys shareholders at an annual meeting by following the process set forth in the Companys By-laws and described under General Information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders may also follow the process set forth in the Companys By-laws for proxy access to nominate individuals for election as a director and to have information about the nominees included in the Companys proxy statement and proxy card for an annual meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A shareholder, or group of up to 20 shareholders, who has owned 3% or more of the Companys outstanding Common Stock continuously for at least three years, may nominate and have included in the Companys annual meeting proxy materials up to the greater of two individuals or 20% of the number of directors on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any nominees who were previously elected to the Board through the proxy access By-law provision at either of the two most recent annual meetings of shareholders and who are re-nominated as a director nominee by the Board count toward the number of individuals shareholders can nominate pursuant to the proxy access By-law provision.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The shareholder(s) and the nominees must satisfy the requirements specified in the By-laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee is responsible for determining whether proxy access candidates satisfy these requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If timely requested by the shareholder(s) who nominated the candidate(s) and the proxy access candidate(s), the Nominating Committee will review the proxy access candidate(s) using the same criteria it applies to new director candidates initially identified by the Nominating Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Time Warner Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notice of 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders and Proxy Statement    7
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 1: Election of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Qualifications, Composition and Tenure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Criteria for Membership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee and the Board take into consideration many factors in reviewing candidates and apply the same criteria to all candidates, including incumbent directors, and some additional criteria when evaluating the qualifications of new director candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes the Company is best served by a board consisting of individuals who share certain core characteristics, such as a high level of integrity, professional accomplishment and business judgment, and who also bring a variety of complementary skills, professional experience, backgrounds and diverse viewpoints and perspectives to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Succession Planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because of the anticipated retirements of several directors from 2016 through 2018, the Nominating Committee retained an outside search firm and began a search in early 2016 to identify, recruit and appoint several new directors who possess the core characteristics required of all directors and the relevant experience and qualifications, complementary skills and fresh perspectives to work effectively with their fellow directors in fulfilling the Boards role in reviewing the Companys strategy and overseeing its businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of the pending Merger, which is expected to close before year-end 2017, the Board suspended the search in October 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Tenure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recognizes the importance of having new directors join the Board regularly to achieve an optimum mix of institutional knowledge and fresh perspectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reflecting a commitment to Board refreshment, the Corporate Governance Policy states that the Board believes the Board and the Company are well-served by having non-employee directors with a mix of tenures and expects the average tenure of non-employee directors will generally not exceed 10 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Corporate Governance Policy provides that non-employee directors are not eligible for nomination for a term during which they will reach age 75.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This commitment to Board refreshment has been demonstrated by the Board recruiting and adding four new directors with highly relevant experience since January 2009, including two in 2009 and one in each of 2010 and 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even with the suspension of the director search, the average tenure of the non-employee Director nominees is approximately nine years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notice of 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders and Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 1: Election of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors Skills and Qualifications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee and Board have identified the following criteria to be considered when evaluating all director candidates, both the incumbent directors selected as nominees and potential new director candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee and Board also considered the business experience listed below under 2017 Annual Meeting Director Nominee Experience in evaluating the incumbent directors nominated for election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Criteria for All Director Candidates
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional Criteria for New Director Candidates
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Personal Qualities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director candidate must possess demonstrated reputation for integrity, judgment, acumen an high professional and personal ethics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Professional Experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New director candidates should have significant high-level leadership experience at a public corporation or other firm, in government or at a non-profit institution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The candidates performance in those leadership roles, as well as the performance of the public corporation, firm or institution during the candidates tenure, are important factors the Nominating Committee considers when evaluating a candidate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director candidate should be financially literate and have significant experience at the policy-making level in business, government or the non-profit sector.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In evaluating director candidates, the Board also considers the categories of business experience discussed below in light of the Companys current and expected future business needs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For incumbent director candidates, the Nominating Committee will also evaluate the candidates past performance on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Diversity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Policy requires the Nominating Committee and the Board to consider the Boards overall composition when evaluating director candidates, including whether the Board has an appropriate combination of professional experience, skills, knowledge and a range of viewpoints and backgrounds in light of the Companys current and expected future business needs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, as set forth in the Policy Statement Regarding Director Nominations, the Nominating Committee believes it is desirable for new candidates to contribute to there being a variety of viewpoints on the Board, which may be enhanced by a mix of different professional and personal backgrounds and experiences.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A majority of the Board, and, unless otherwise determined by the Board, any newly nominated non-employee candidate for the Board, must satisfy the criteria to be considered an independent director under the Companys By-laws and Corporate Governance Policy and the applicable New York Stock Exchange (the NYSE) listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Commitment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director candidate must have the time and ability to make a constructive contribution to the Board, as well as a clear commitment to fulfilling a directors fiduciary duties and serving the interests of the Companys shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, to help ensure directors have sufficient time to devote to their responsibilities as a director, the Board has determined that non-employee directors should generally serve on no more than four other public company boards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are required to offer their resignation upon a significant change in their primary professional responsibilities, and, in such case, the Nominating Committee will make a recommendation to the Board as to whether to accept the offer of resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committee Eligibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee believes it is desirable for new director candidates to satisfy the requirements for serving on the Boards committees, as set forth in the charters for those committees and applicable regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee believes it is useful for director candidates to have experience as a director of a major public corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Age.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Companys By-laws and Corporate Governance Policy, each director candidate must be at least 21 years of age at the commencement of service as a director and is not eligible for nomination for a term during which he or she will reach age 75.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Antitrust Requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director candidate must satisfy the requirements of antitrust laws, which limit service as an officer or director of the Companys significant competitors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leadership and Senior Management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Experience serving as a founder, chief executive officer or a senior executive of a major corporation or firm (or a comparable position in government or the non-profit sector).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director candidates who have served in significant leadership positions over an extended period, especially chief executive officer positions, are important as they bring experience with developing, implementing and overseeing the execution of business plans and strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director candidates with this experience also generally possess strong leadership qualities and the ability to identify and develop those qualities in others.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Media, Communications or Technology Businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Knowledge of and experience in media, communications and/or technology businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Relevant industry experience is important in understanding the Companys business, strategy and long-range plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, director candidates who have relevant industry experience can offer advice and insights regarding new technologies and business models, which is particularly important with the significant changes that are occurring in the media and entertainment industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finance, Investments or Banking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Knowledge of and experience in finance, investments and/or banking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Experience in this area is important because it assists the directors in understanding and evaluating the Companys capital structure, financing and investment activities and financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It i also important because it assists them in understanding and overseeing the Companys financial reporting and internal controls.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director candidates who have experience overseeing investments directly or through service as a director of an investment company or state pension fund provide strong insights into shareholder perspectives and views on a range of matters, including governance, operating performance and oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the nominees who serve on the Audit and Finance Committee (the Audit Committee) qualify as financially literate under the NYSE listing standards and three qualify as audit committee financial experts under the SECs rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The nominees for director also include:

sentences.text: a former trustee of Teachers Insurance and Annuity Association, a life insurance company;

sentences.text: a director of BlackRock, Inc.

sentences.text: a Partner and Managing Director at Warburg Pincus LLC;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Founder and Chief Executive Officer of Main Street Advisors, Inc., a private company that provides investment and financial advisory services to high net worth individuals; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a director of Citigroup Inc. and Voya Financial, Inc. who also was the former Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Carver Bancorp, Inc.

sentences.text: Consumer-Focused Businesses.

sentences.text: Knowledge of and experience in businesses with products or services that directly serve consumers.

sentences.text: As a Company focused on capitalizing on the growing global demand for high-quality video content and evolving consumer viewing behaviors, director candidates with expertise in consumer-focused businesses can provide insights regarding the marketing and distribution of the Companys content to consumers around the world.

sentences.text: The vast majority of the nominees for director have experience as either a senior executive officer or member of the board of a consumer-focused business.

sentences.text: The nominees for director include:

sentences.text: Director candidates who have served in the government sector or have significant legal or regulatory experience can provide insight into working constructively with governments around the world and addressing significant public policy matters, such as piracy.

sentences.text: a former Attorney General of the United States

sentences.text: The nominees for director include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: International Operations or Global Economic Policy.

sentences.text: Time Warners success depends, in part, on its ability to continue to grow its international operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director candidates with international experience can provide useful business and cultural perspectives regarding the Companys international operations.

sentences.text: the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Axel Springer SE, an integrated multimedia company based in Germany, who is also a current director of Vodafone Group Plc;

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Chair of the Albright Stonebridge Group, a global strategy firm, who also has experience in global economic policy as a former U.S. Secretary of Commerce and nearly 30 years of international business experience from his prior roles with Kellogg Company.

sentences.text: Background of Director Nominees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Set forth below is information regarding each of the nine nominees, including their ages as of April 29, 2017 and key skills and professional qualifications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and the Nominating Committee believe that the depth and breadth of qualifications, skills and experiences of the nominees, all of whom are seasoned leaders and current directors of the Company, have contributed to an effective and well-functioning Board and that, individually and as a whole, the nominees possess the necessary qualifications to provide effective oversight of and advice to the Companys management and businesses.

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends a vote FOR the election of the nine director nominees.

sentences.text: William P. Barr
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent Director Board Committees: Compensation (Chair); Nominating
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior Professional Experience: Mr. Barr served as Of Counsel of Kirkland & Ellis LLP from January 2009 to July 2009; Executive Vice President and General Counsel of Verizon Communications Inc. from June 2000 to December 2008; Executive Vice President and General Counsel of GTE Corporation from 1994 to June 2000; a partner of Shaw, Pittman, Potts & Trowbridge (now Pillsbury Winthrop Shaw Pittman LLP) from 1993 to 1994; the 77th Attorney General of the United States from 1991 to 1993; Deputy Attorney General of the United States from 1990 to 1991; Assistant Attorney General for the Office of Legal Counsel from 1989 to 1990; and a partner of Shaw, Pittman, Potts & Trowbridge from 1984 to 1989.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Public Company Boards: Dominion Resources, Inc. and Och-Ziff Capital Management Group LLC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the past five years, Mr. Barr served as a director of Selected Funds and a trustee of Clipper Funds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Skills and Qualifications: Mr. Barr, who is Chair of the Companys Compensation Committee, brings leadership experience in government as a former Attorney General of the United States and head of the U.S. Department of Justice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He also has more than 14 years of leadership and senior management experience in major corporations in the media and telecommunications industries, as the former Executive Vice President and General Counsel of Verizon Communications Inc. and its predecessor, GTE Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a former senior executive at Verizon Communications Inc. and GTE Corporation, Mr. Barr has knowledge of and experience in broadband and mobile distribution systems, including the distribution of video content, as well as experience in consumer-focused businesses with international operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a former Attorney General of the United States, General Counsel and partner of a major law firm, Mr. Barr has a strong background in a wide range of legal, regulatory and government relations matters, including intellectual property and antitrust policy, as well as overseeing the negotiation of and obtaining regulatory approvals for significant mergers and acquisitions, such as the Bell Atlantic Corporation and GTE Corporation merger that formed Verizon Communications Inc. and Verizon Communications Inc.s subsequent acquisitions of MCI Communications Corporation and Alltel Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a former director of Selected Funds, where he was a director or trustee of three separate investment companies in the fund complex, Mr. Barr has knowledge of and experience in finance and investments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 2: Ratification of Appointment of Independent Auditor
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 2: Ratification of Appointment of Independent Auditor
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is responsible for the appointment, compensation and oversight of the Companys independent auditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee annually reviews the independent auditors qualifications, performance, fees and independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following its review in December 2016, the Audit Committee appointed Ernst & Young LLP (EY) as the Companys independent auditor for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EY has served as the Companys independent auditor since 2001, when the Company was formed through the merger of America Online, Inc. (now known as Historic AOL LLC) and Time Warner Inc. (now named Historic TW Inc.).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company is requesting that the shareholders ratify the appointment of EY as the Companys independent auditor for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee and the Board believe EY is independent and that it is in the best interests of the Company and its shareholders to retain EY as the Companys independent auditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rotation of Lead Audit Partner and Annual Consideration of Audit Firm Rotation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee believes it is important for the independent auditor to maintain its objectivity and independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, since 2004 the Audit Committee has reviewed on an annual basis whether the Audit Committee should have a policy requiring the regular rotation of the independent auditor and reports its conclusion to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To date, the Audit Committee has determined not to adopt such a policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in accordance with SEC rules and the Companys Policy Regarding Audit Partner Rotation, audit partners are subject to limitations on the number of consecutive years they may provide services to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the lead audit partner, the maximum number of consecutive years in that capacity is five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with these requirements, a new lead audit partner was selected for the audit of the Companys 2014 financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee and its Chair are involved in the process for selecting the lead audit partner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EYs Attendance at the Annual Meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Representatives of EY will be present at the Annual Meeting with the opportunity to make a statement if they desire to do so and to respond to appropriate questions from shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends a vote FOR the ratification of the appointment of Ernst & Young LLP as independent auditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote Required for Approval
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The affirmative vote of a majority of the votes duly cast by the holders of Common Stock is required to ratify the appointment of EY (i.e., the number of shares voted for the proposal must exceed the number of shares voted against the proposal).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, shareholder approval is not required for the appointment of EY because the Audit Committee is responsible for selecting the Companys independent auditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No determination has been made as to what action the Audit Committee or the Board would take if shareholders do not ratify the appointment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 3: Annual Advisory Vote to Approve Named Executive Officer  Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 3: Annual Advisory Vote to Approve Named Executive Officer Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with SEC rules, Time Warner is asking shareholders to approve the following resolution at the Annual Mee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the Companys shareholders approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation paid to the Companys named executive officers, as disclosed in the Companys Proxy Statement for the 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders pursuant to tem 402 of Regulation S-K, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, compensation tables and narratives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 was a successful year for Time Warner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company delivered strong financial performance in 2016, including 4% growth in revenues, 10% growth in both Operating Income and Adjusted Operating Income, 8% growth in EPS and 23% growth in Adjusted EPS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company also achieved significant milestones in 2016, not only in making progress on its key long-term strategic objectives, but also in entering into the Merger Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Merger will accelerate the Companys strategy and its ability to innovate, and will provide an attractive premium to shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys stock performance during 2016 also was very strong with a total shareholder return of 52% for the year compared to 12% for the S&P 500 and an 11% average for its entertainment industry peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee and the Board believe
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the Companys compensation program and the compensation actions taken to encourage and reward performance during 2016 effectively supported the execution of the Companys long-range plans,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the compensation actions appropriately reflected the Companys financial performance and the NEOs individual performance, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the transaction-related program implemented in connection with the Merger provides effective incentives for the NEOs to support the closing of the Merger and to continue delivering successful company performance while the Merger is pending.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The pay-for-performance design of the Companys compensation program, the Companys 2016 performance, the NEOs individual performance, and the Compensation Committees determination of the 2016 compensation paid to the NEOs are described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis (CD&A) beginning on page 47.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders are encouraged to read the CD&A before deciding how to vote on this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to both the earlier closing of the Merger and the Boards consideration of the vote at the Annual Meeting on the Companys proposal on the frequency of holding an advisory vote on NEO compensation, the next advisory vote on NEO compensation is expected to take place at the 2018 annual meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends a vote FOR the approval of the resolution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote Required for Approval
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The affirmative vote of a majority of the votes duly cast by the holders of Common Stock is required to approve this proposal (i.e., the number of shares voted for the proposal must exceed the number of shares voted against the proposal).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the vote on executive compensation is advisory and, therefore, not binding on the Company, the Board or the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and the Compensation Committee will consider the outcome of the vote when making future executive compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 4: Advisory Vote on the Frequency of Holding an Advisory Vote to Approve Named Executive Officer Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n accordance with SEC rules, the Company is providing shareholders the opportunity to vote, on an advisory basis, on whether uture advisory votes to approve NEO compensation should be held every one, two or three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has provided shareholders the opportunity to vote, on an advisory basis, on NEO compensation each year starting with the 2011 annual meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that continuing to include a proposal for shareholders to vote, on an advisory basis, on NEO compensation every year is appropriate for the Company and its shareholders because shareholders have expressed a preference for annual votes not only in the 2011 advisory vote on the subject, but also during their engagement with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to both the earlier closing of the Merger and the Boards consideration of the vote on this proposal, the Company expects the next advisory vote on NEO compensation to take place at the 2018 annual meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders may cast their vote on their preferred voting frequency by choosing the option of one year, two years or three years or may abstain from voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In considering this vote, shareholders may wish to review the information presented in connection with Proposal 3 (the advisory vote to approve NEO compensation) on page 22 and in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis beginning on page 47.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends a vote FOR the option of EVERY ONE YEAR as the frequency with which shareholders are provided an advisory vote to approve NEO compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote Required for Approval
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The vote on this proposal is not intended to approve or disapprove the recommendation of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If one of the frequency options (one year, two years or three years) receives the vote of a majority of the votes duly cast by the holders of Common Stock, t will be the frequency preferred by shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the vote is advisory and, therefore, not binding on the Company or the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board will consider the vote when deciding whether shareholders are provided an advisory vote to approve NEO compensation every one, two or three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the expected timing of the Merger, the Company does not expect to provide shareholders another advisory vote on NEO compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Time Warner Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notice of 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders and Proxy Statement    23
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Strong Governance Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Time Warner has strong corporate governance practices and policies, including the Corporate Governance Policy (initially adopted in 2002), which help ensure that the Board not only provides independent oversight of management, but also has the experience, expertise and information to work effectively with management in making strategic and other key business decisions for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because corporate governance practices evolve, the Board reviews its Corporate Governance Policy, committee charters, and other governance documents at least annually and updates them as necessary or appropriate, taking into account the effectiveness of the Companys policies and practices, legal requirements, industry practices and shareholder views.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Examples of Strong Governance Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key examples of Time Warners long-standing commitment to strong corporate governance policies and practices include the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Independence: Under the Corporate Governance Policy, a substantial majority of the directors must be independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All current directors, other than the CEO, are independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent Board Committees: Only independent directors serve on the Boards committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lead Independent Director with significant authority and responsibilities since 2006.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board Leadership Policy requires consideration of Board leadership at least annually, with disclosure to shareholders on factors reviewed (see the 2017 report posted at www.timewarner.com/leadership).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Qualifications and Ongoing Education: The Board believes the Company is best served by a board of directors whose members have a variety of professional experience, backgrounds, qualifications and complementary skills and who bring diverse viewpoints and perspectives to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has identified experience in the media, technology and consumer-facing industries, as well as success in building and managing a large and successful global business, including businesses with evolving business models, as key qualifications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards experience is reinforced through a robust ongoing director education program, including in-depth regular discussions and information (including from third parties) on the trends, competitive positioning, and emerging challenges and opportunities in the media and entertainment industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Accountability: Directors are elected annually (i.e., no classified board) and, in an uncontested election, each director nominee receiving more for votes than against votes is elected to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Resignation By-Law Provision: If an incumbent director nominee in an uncontested election receives more against votes than for votes, the director must submit, no later than two weeks after the certification of the shareholder vote by the Company, an offer to resign from the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board would consider the resignation offer within 90 days of certification of the vote and either accept the resignation offer or reject the resignation offer and seek to address the underlying cause(s) of the against votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Strong Director Succession Practices: The Companys strong director succession practices are demonstrated by the Board recruiting and adding four new directors with highly relevant experience since January 2009, including two in 2009 and one in each of 2010 and 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because of the anticipated retirements of several directors from 2016 through 2018, the Nominating Committee began a search in early 2016 to identify new candidates to serve as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of the pending Merger, the Board suspended the search in October 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Tenure: To help ensure the Board has an appropriate balance of experience and fresh perspectives, the Board believes it is well-served by having non-employee directors with a mix of tenures, and the Corporate Governance Policy states that the Board expects that the average tenure of non-employee directors will generally not exceed 10 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 24  Time Warner Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notice of 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders and Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Limits on Service on Other Public Company Boards: To ensure non-employee directors have sufficient time to devote to their responsibilities, they may not serve on the board of more than four other public companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Evaluations: The Board conducts rigorous annual self-evaluations in which
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the members of the Nominating Committee discuss with the other directors the composition, responsibilities, leadership structure, committee process, and overall effectiveness of the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the Nominating Committee reviews the findings and recommendations from those discussions; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the Nominating Committee recommends to the Board for approval an action plan to address items identified through the evaluation process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management reports to the Board during the year on the progress in implementing the action plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The evaluations have informed the Boards decisions in areas such as director and executive succession planning, topics to be addressed at Board meetings, and opportunities for the Board to expand its interactions with management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committees also discuss similar topics during their annual self-evaluation processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Supermajority Voting Provisions in the Companys Charter or By-Laws
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Special Meeting Rights: Shareholders have the right to request special meetings (15% threshold).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy Access By-law Provision: Adopted in 2016, as described in more detail below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Shareholder Rights Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Strong Executive Succession Practices: Management succession planning is a priority for the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with the Companys history of developing leaders internally, the Boards goal is to be in a position to appoint its most senior executives from within the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO succession planning is overseen by the Nominating Committee, which has developed a comprehensive program that encompasses both emergency succession of the CEO and long-term succession planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee and the Board also periodically discuss succession planning for other senior management with the CEO and the Chief Human Resources Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Lead Independent Director also facilitates additional discussions among the independent directors about succession planning at executive sessions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of the Companys succession practices, senior executives of the Company and its divisions regularly meet with the Board and its committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Requirements for Executive Officers and Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Hedging or Pledging: The Company prohibits executive officers and directors from engaging in hedging transactions with Common Stock, holding Common Stock in a margin account or pledging Common Stock as collateral for a loan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Codes of Conduct: The Company has robust codes of conduct for its executive officers and directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ESG Disclosure: The Company keeps shareholders, the investment community and other stakeholders informed about its activities relating to environmental, social and governance matters, including through its website  (www.timewarner.com/citizenship).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company also plans to issue a new corporate responsibility report in 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy Access
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In January 2016, the Board amended the Companys By-laws to implement proxy access, which provides shareholders the ability to nominate individuals for election as a director and to have the nominee included in the Companys proxy statement and proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards adoption of proxy access followed
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) discussions with the Companys major institutional shareholders beginning in 2014, including a series of conversations in autumn 2015 and early 2016 with institutional shareholders representing over 40% of the Companys outstanding shares of Common Stock, which included discussions of their views on specific proxy access provisions;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a careful evaluation by the Nominating Committee of shareholder views, policies and votes at other companies on proxy access, evolving practices at other large corporations, relevant academic research, the potential impact on the Company of the adoption of proxy access, alternatives to proxy access and proxy access frameworks adopted by other companies; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the receipt of a shareholder proposal in late December 2015 requesting the Company adopt proxy access with 3% ownership/3-year holding requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys proxy access provision has the following key features:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3% ownership threshold
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Time Warner Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notice of 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders and Proxy Statement    25
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3-year holding period
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Greater of 2 nominees or 20% of Board, for election at an annual meeting of shareholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Up to 20 shareholders may group together to satisfy 3% ownership threshold
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards adoption of proxy access enhanced shareholders rights without taking away any of the existing rights shareholders had to nominate directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee also amended the Policy Statement regarding Director Nominations to provide that, if timely requested by the shareholder(s) who nominate director candidates through proxy access, the Committee will eview proxy access candidates using the same criteria it applies to other new director candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes the Companys proxy access framework is responsive to the views expressed by the Companys shareholders, strikes an appropriate balance between enhancing shareholder rights and adequately protecting the interests of all shareholders, provides shareholders a meaningful voice in the nomination and election of directors and is consistent with prevailing practices and the proxy access frameworks adopted by other Fortune 500 companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By-law Amendment in Connection with the AT&T Merger Agreement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with entering into the Merger Agreement with AT&T, the Board amended the By-laws to provide that, unless the Company consents in writing to an alternative forum, any of the following types of lawsuits must be brought in the Delaware courts:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) any shareholder action brought on behalf of the Company,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) any claim asserting a breach of a fiduciary duty owed by any current or former director, officer or shareholder of the Company to the Company or its shareholders,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) any state law-based claims arising under the General Corporation Law of the State of Delaware,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) any claims seeking to enforce remedies under the Companys Certificate of Incorporation or By-laws,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) any claims as to which the General Corporation Law of the State of Delaware confers jurisdiction on the Delaware courts, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) claims governed by the internal affairs doctrine (collectively, the Covered Claims).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that the adoption of this amendment to the By-laws was in the best interests of the Company and its shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Delaware courts are best suited to address any Covered Claims given that the Company is incorporated in Delaware and the Delaware courts have expertise in overseeing claims governed by Delaware law, including in the context of mergers and acquisitions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, designating the Delaware courts as the exclusive forum for any Covered Claims reduces the costs of litigation compared to litigation conducted in multiple jurisdictions as well as the risk of disparate outcomes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Engagement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board values the views of the Companys shareholders and believes shareholder engagement is a key component of its strong governance practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more than a decade, the Company has had a practice of engaging with shareholders on governance and related matters throughout the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the period prior to the 2016 annual meeting of shareholders, the Company contacted its 100 largest shareholders, representing over 50% of the Companys outstanding shares of Common Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following the 2016 annual meeting, the Company continued to engage with shareholders on a range of topics, including executive compensation matters, such as the performance measures used in the executive compensation program and changes to the Companys secondary peer group, and governance and corporate responsibility matters, reaching out to shareholders representing approximately 45% of the Companys outstanding shares of Common Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company also contacted shareholders representing over 50% of the Companys outstanding shares of Common Stock regarding the Merger in connection with the special meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and its committees are regularly updated on shareholder feedback and consider the views of shareholders in making their decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 26  Time Warner Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Highly Qualified and Independent Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Time Warners Board consists of ten highly qualified, skilled and dedicated directors, nine of whom are independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These directors possess a combination of qualifications, skills and experiences that enable them to provide effective oversight of the Company and management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Barksdale will retire from the Board at the Annual Meeting in accordance with the retirement provisions in the Corporate Governance Policy and, in light of the pending Merger, the size of the Board will be reduced and the position not filled with a new director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a detailed discussion of the qualifications, skills and experience of each of the nominees or director, see Background of Director Nominees beginning on page 11.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To conclude that a director is independent, the Board must determine that the director has no material relationship with the Company or its subsidiaries and that the director is free of any other relationship that would interfere with the directors exercise of independent judgment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has established guidelines on director independence that address employment and commercial relationships that may affect a directors independence, as well as categories of relationships that are not deemed material for purposes of director independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to applying these guidelines, which are included in the Corporate Governance Policy, the Board considers the NYSE listing standards and the Companys By-laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on its annual review of director independence, the Board determined that all of the current directors and all of the nominees for director are independent, except for Mr. Bewkes, who is an executive officer of the Company and thus cannot qualify as an independent director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining the independence of the Companys directors, as described under Transactions Considered in Making Independence Determinations beginning on page 36, the Board considered relevant transactions, relationships and arrangements as required by the guidelines, NYSE listing standards and the Companys By-laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Leadership
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The current leadership structure consists of one individual serving as Chairman of the Board and CEO and an independent director serving as Lead Independent Director with meaningful responsibilities and authority, who serve as part of a Board consisting of ten engaged and effective directors, nine of whom are independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards Policy on Determining the Leadership Structure of the Board of Directors requires the Nominating Committee and the Board to conduct an annual review of the Boards leadership structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In its annual review in January 2017, the Board determined that the current leadership structure is effective and continues to be the optimal structure for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Current Leadership Structure Chairman of the Board and CEO  Jeffrey L. Bewkes Lead Independent Director  Robert C. Clark Independent Directors  9 of 10 directors are independent Board Committees  All members are independent
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lead Independent Directors Authority and Responsibilities
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Lead Independent Directors authority and responsibilities include
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Presiding at meetings of the Board at which the Chairman of the Board is not present and at executive sessions of the Board (unless the matter under consideration is within the jurisdiction of one of the Boards committees, in which case, the Chairman of the relevant committee presides).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Authority to call meetings of independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Serving as the liaison between the Chairman of the Board and the other directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Authority to approve the agenda (including the time allocated to items) and information for Board meetin
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advising the Chairman of the Board with respect to consultants who may report directly to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Serving as interim Chairman of the Board in the event of the death or incapacitation of the Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Availability, as appropriate, for communication with the Companys shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notice of 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders and Proxy Statement    27

sentences.text: Table of Contents
